#Text=Colombia releases detailed report about the FARC
#Text=Tuesday , February 1 , 2005

#Text=Colombia — The Colombian Caracol Radio reported on January 31 , 2005 that the government of Colombia released a detailed document which describes how the FARC operates in Colombia and around the world .

#Text=The report was prepared by the Unidad Administrativa Especial de Información y Análisis Financiero del Ministerio de Hacienda(Special Administrative Unit of the Information and Financial Analysis of the Ministry of the Finance ) and describes how the FARC operates and manage their finances .
#Text=The study was delivered to the Colombian government at the end of the last year .
#Text=The FARC expenses
#Text=According to Caracol Radio the most important facts from the report are the following :
#Text=Guerrilla
#Text=The report identifies three types of guerrilla :
#Text=High rank : these members can participate in the high level operations , including the drug trafficking .
#Text=They have access to beer , seafood , gatorade ( a soft drink ) , prawns , shampoo , gel for the hair , brandy , and whiskey .
#Text=Daily cost : $ 6 798 pesos ( $US1 equals 2359 Colombian pesos ) .
#Text=Average rank : these member can participate in illicit activities such as kidnapping , extorsion and theft .
#Text=Daily cost : $ 4,917 pesos .
#Text=Low rank : they are supported by the secretaryship or other structures because they operate in difficult conditions .
#Text=Daily cost : $ 2.800 pesos .
#Text=28 percent belongs to the high ranking members of FARC , 64 percent belongs to the middle ranks and 8 percent to the lower ranks .
#Text=Kidnapping
#Text=The costs of feeding people who are kidnapped is 2,382 million pesos
#Text=Logistic Intendance
#Text=20 billion pesos are the expenses of 690 thousand units of armament , that include as much ammunition expenses as weapon expenses during a year .
#Text=14 billion pesos are the expenses of quartermaster equipment ( uniforms , machetes , boots ) during a year .
#Text=up to 4 thousand 256 million pesos are the expenses on explosives .
#Text=Health
#Text=There is evidence that FARC members are under specialized treatments in recognized clinical of Ecuador and Venezuela .
#Text=Expenses of up to 1450 million pesos a year .
#Text=Transportation
#Text=Vehicles and gasoline .
#Text=Each FARC structure does between 14 and 18 short trips per month , and between 8 and 11 long trips , spending up to 1500 million pesos .
#Text=Communications
#Text=Purchase of radios and cellular telephones and batteries costs up to 8311 millions pesos .
#Text=Chemical
#Text=Chemical products used during the narcotic processing .
#Text=722.000 gallons of gasoline are used .
#Text=Expenses with gasoline are up to 12515 million per year .
#Text=Other chemical reagents : up to 305 billion pesos per year .
#Text=Education
#Text=FARC recruit people of between 16 and 30 years of age .
#Text=The new recruits first get a minimum information on internal , objective statutes of the organization and commitments .
#Text=After been incorporated , the members are sent to training basic schools by a period between 3-5 months .
#Text=When they leaves the scholl they are considered flat guerrilla .
#Text=After two years depending on profits and behavior the guellicas can get promotion to squadron commander , delegate of guerrilla , commander , etc.
#Text=Each student spends about 10,000 pesos per day in feeding and uniforms .
#Text=The FARC annual expenses for personnel and education are 5110 million pesos .
#Text=In a optimistic hypothesis the FARC train 200 men per year in each one of their 7 schools .
#Text=Propaganda
#Text=327 million pesos are expenses with social programs supporting indigenous groups , associations of farmers , students and labour unions workers and leaders .
#Text=internet : 20 million pesos
#Text=Radio : Intelligence detected between 5 and 7 clandestine radios of low range but with the possibility of moving them through all the territory : up to 431 million pesos .
#Text=Solidarity founds
#Text=Support to the captured members and their families .
#Text=Prisoner support : 7 billion pesos by year .
#Text=Family support : 1773 million pesos by year .
#Text=International front
#Text=Support to the FARC activities in foreign countries : 476 million pesos by year .
#Text=The FARC incomes
#Text=Drugs
#Text=Protecting plantations : $ 541 million pesos .
#Text=Storage of the leaf of the coca : 953 million pesos .
#Text=Production of base cocaine : 886 million pesos .
#Text=Production in sophisticated laboratories : 2621 million pesos .
#Text=Clandestine airports
#Text=There are 57 clandestine airports that the narco-traffickers use(this is a big number since in Colombia there are only 73 official airports ) .
#Text=The FARC rent the use of these airport to drug-dealers and receive income of up to 7154 million pesos from doing so .
#Text=Commercialization
#Text=The report says that the Farc directly commercializes 30 percent of the drug that is produced , and the remaining 70 percent is left to international networks of drug trafficking .
#Text=Cocaine commercialization :
#Text=incomes up to 7 billion pesos
#Text=Other activities
#Text=Kidnapping : up to 88560 million pesos is gained per year through kidnapping .
#Text=Extorsion : 1 billion 569 million , 315 thousand pesos per year .
#Text=Assaults on banks : 2,780 million pesos per year .
#Text=Cattle robbery : 52 thousand 668 million pesos per year .
#Text=Fuel robbery : 42 billion pesos .
#Text=According to the Vice-Minister of Defense Andrés Peñate the majority of the FARC incomes comes from the commercialization of the drugs , followed by extorsion and kidnapping .
